See also: pommes and pommés

German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

Short from Pommes frites with a spelling pronunciation.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈpɔməs/

Noun[edit]

Pommes f (genitive Pommes, plural Pommes)

  1. (plural) fries, French fries, chips (UK)
    Ich esse gern Pommes.
    I like fries.
  2. (singular, colloquial) a single fry, a single chip (UK)
    Mir ist ’ne Pommes runtergefallen.
    I’ve dropped a fry.
  3. (singular, colloquial) a portion of fries
    Bringst Du mir eine Portion Pommes mit?
    Can you get me some fries?

Declension[edit]

Declension of Pommes

indef.def.noundef.noun
nominativeeinediePommesdiePommes
genitiveeinerderPommesderPommes
dativeeinerderPommesdenPommes
accusativeeinediePommesdiePommes

Synonyms[edit]

  • Fritte f, Fritten pl
  • Pommes frites pl
  • (a portion of fries): eine Portion Pommes
